steps.text: Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a deep saucepan over medium heat, once oil is warm (not hot) add the garlic.
When garlic gets golden around the edges (~2 min), add milk and salt.
Bring milk to a gentle simmer, stirring often to avoid scorching and film.
Gradually stir in semolina, keep stirring and folding semolina for about 3 minutes, until it begins to pull away from the side of the pan.
Add melted butter and keep folding until all of the butter is incorporated.
When all butter is absorbed, turn off heat.
Even out the surface with a spatula, and add egg yolk.  Spread over the entire surface and fold in quickly (before yolk begins to cook).
Add cheese and continue to alternate between folding and stirring.
Turn out onto prepared cookie sheet and flatten to 3/8‚Äù thick.
Allow to cool for about 45 minutes, or until dough can be handled.
Cut into whatever shape or size you want.
Sear in a hot pan to form a crust of grilled cheese.
